pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3: According to the sub-commentary, [Sp-yoj.1.618](), the whole hand refers to the five fingers: _pañcaṅguliṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ_, “It is said with regard to the five fingers.” The same point is made at [](Kkh-pṭ): _Sakalaṃ hatthanti sakalā aṅguliyo_, “The whole hand means all the fingers.”
